headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  LEMLE, MURIEL CHARLOTTE ECKSTEIN

snippet: LEMLE--Muriel Charlotte Eckstein, nickname "Peggy," 95, passed away at home on February 6, 2016 after a long illness. She was devoted wife of Clarence "Bob" for 50 years until he passed away July 1997, proud mother of Stuart (wife Marian), Russell (Victoria) and Craig (Amy), kvelling grandmother of Jon (Molly), Cliff (Jamie), Tracey (Marcus), Casey (Ed), Elise (Devin), Julia and Kyle and loving great-grandmother of Vivienne and Madison. Born January 21, 1921 in New York City to Harry and Bertha Eckstein with brother Phillip, she grew up in Weehawken, NJ, received bachelors and teaching degrees from Beaver College. She moved to White Plains in 1951 and lived there for the remainder of her life. She was a dedicated contributor to civic activities, including leadership of numerous White Plains school system parents' organizations and a decades-long volunteer and member of the Board of Directors at White Plains Hospital. She will be dearly missed for her expansive generosity, loyalty and thoughtfulness by all who knew her. Private graveside service for the immediate family is February 8. Donations in her memory may be made to White Plains Hospital or the charity of choice. 1/3
